intro: Tripolium subulatum, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. Tripolium subulatum is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds, making it a hardy species in coastal ecosystems.
